intro: Galium stellariifolium, commonly known as starleaf bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on long pedicels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive star-shaped appearance when viewed from above. Galium stellariifolium thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
